column5: Good stuff!
Yep, them are big, and them are ugly, but they're fish, Way to go you two  Joey
Good job you two. Way to go. Excellent report.
Nice Carp WTG!
Nice big wild river hogs guys! WTG! My roses are envious! HH

Well, it was such a great summer-like day, Bly and I just couldn't stay at home tonight.  We decided to head to a local spot to see if the carp had moved in yet.  The tribs are pretty much done until the opener, and nothing else is really open season right now.  Anyhow, we got to our spot at around 830 and began the waiting game...and wait we did....  Nothing...not a sniff of our bait for a whole hour.  Finally, at 930 they started to bite!  Our first carp of the season was caught using some ground mix on a feeder and a fruity boilie.  This was 31 inches long and was about 15 pounds.   Bly was next up...about a half hour later, she finally gets a fish on...after a nice tussle, she landed this 32.25" one...again...another 15 pounder...   About 20 minutes later...after feeling lots of action on her line, she landed another one!!   We know how much Wayne loves our carp reports, so we dedicated our first one of the season to him....  That's all for now....good night!!
Is carp good to eat i caught a sheep head last year and someone told me it was a type of carp and that it tastes bad.

Nice big fish. Thanks for the report.  Small carp and sheep head are good to eat. It's better to check "The 2007 - 2008 Guide to Eating Ontario Sport Fish " first. http://www.ene.gov.on.ca/envision/guide/
Yeah, apparently they're ok to eat but I'd be careful. They didn't develop a mouth like that from suckin' on oranges.  Another nice report from you guys. WTG!
LOL  Nice report guys. I'm hoping to hit a secret carp spot i know of later in the year for some monsters. Keep the posts coming. You write solid reports.  Tight Lines  -R-
I hope you had a proper net for landin' 'em, eh?
Nice report and pictures, good size fish too.  As for eating them, tried some smoked carp once, I've got other fish that I'd rather eat!
NICELY DONE YOU 2
HA!!! I was wonderin' when y'all were goin' to do the dirty deed and get ugly bumps!!!  Great report and pics y'all!!!
Good stuff guys.Nice hats. Joe
Bly 2 and CCMT 1 but who is counting?
Excellent report and read as usual....  Nice pic's.. WTG u 2
good report,congrats
My thoughts exactly   lol     Great report and pics.
The Dream Team nails another outing.  Very nice, Cliff and Carole.
WTG guys nice to see you can always find some fins in season.  I have to know Bly do those non slip gloves really help you hold slimy Carp
They help some, but mostly, they help keep the carp stink off my hands
Oh thats a good thing

WTG...Carole and Cliff...can't wait to get the baitrunner in action...got some crappie fishing to tend to first though...  BTW...Big Cliff introduced me to a product call "Nok-Out" ...works real well to eliminate odours...fish, gas, cat piss, etc...  Got some for Maureen to spray her dogs with after they encounter skunks (they never learn!)  Can be purchased in pet stores and soon will be in bait and tackle shops...  Handy to carry in your tackle bag...eliminates human odour when hunting and fishing...use sparingly...

Fantastic catches!  Nothing smells and feels better on the hands than carp slime  I fished one trib on Thursday and it was totally devoid of steel and suckers...Fishing for carp doesn't seem half bad this time of year...Looks like I might be able to Christen the new carp rod sooner than I expected.   WTG you two
Yah tailed them babies right????  At least there's something good looking in the last two pictures Cliff !
Thanks everyone....it was great to fight these guys again...they were a bit lethargic, but they'll liven up once the waters warm a little more!
some nice looking fish!
Nice fish, Congrats and a great start to the season for you.  Mike
Nice fish guys !!!!..great pics too.....cheers
